meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - Alright, let's get this review started!

Luigi's Mansion 2 HD is a blast from the past, and I'm not just talking about Luigi's iconic green hat. This remastered version of the 2006 classic brings back all the charm, humor, and ghostly hijinks we love about the Mario brothers' spooky adventures.

Now, I know what you're thinking: "What's new, old friend?" Well, let me tell you - this HD upgrade doesn't reinvent the wheel (or Poltergust 3000, for that matter). Instead, it takes the original and gives it a fresh coat of paint. The graphics are snazzy, controls are smooth, and the multiplayer mode is still as fun as ever.

But let's be real, folks - this game isn't just about aesthetics; it's about gameplay. And, honestly, not much has changed here. If you loved Luigi's Mansion 2 back in the day, you'll love it just as much now. The puzzles are still clever, the boss battles are still challenging, and that silly little Professor E. Gadd is still... well, professorial.

Now, I know some critics (ahem, Checkpoint Gaming) might say that this remake doesn't address the original's "core gameplay issues." To that, I say: what issues? The game still holds up today - it's not broken; it just needed a little TLC to look and play its best on modern hardware.

So, if you're looking for a fun, family-friendly gaming experience with a dash of humor and adventure, Luigi's Mansion 2 HD is the perfect treat. And if you're feeling nostalgic for those Halloween nights spent playing as Luigi, this remastered version will transport you right back to that spooky good time.

But don't take my word for it - go ahead and check out what our friends at IGN Spain have to say (90/100), or get the lowdown from Games.cz (80/100). Heck, even Daily Star is on board with their 80/100 score. Yeah, this game might not be perfect, but it's a solid addition to any gaming collection.

Now, if you'll excuse me, I have some ghosts to catch...
